p: Nautilus' basic attacks deal increased physical damage and roots his target briefly. Staggering blow cannot trigger more than once every few seconds on the same target.
q: Nautilus hurls his anchor forward. If it hits a champion, he drags both himself and the opponent close together. If it hits terrain, Nautilus instead pulls himself to the anchor, the cooldown of Dredge Line is reduced by half, and half the Mana cost is refunded.
w: Nautilus surrounds himself with dark energies, gaining a shield that blocks incoming damage. While the shield persists, his attacks apply a damage over time effect to enemies around his target.
e: Nautilus slams the ground, causing the earth to explode around him in a set of three explosions. Each explosion damages and slows enemies.
r: Nautilus fires a shockwave into the earth that chases an opponent. This shockwave rips up the earth above it, knocking enemies into the air. When it reaches the opponent, the shockwave erupts, knocking his target into the air and stunning them.

blurd: A lonely legend as old as the first piers sunk in Bilgewater, the armored goliath known as Nautilus roams the dark waters off the coast of the Blue Flame Isles. Driven by a forgotten betrayal, he strikes without warning, swinging his enormous anchor to...
name: Nautilus
title: the Titan of the Depths
